* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is a [demon](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* appears only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic. |                                                                                       |

A **strange larva**, &, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a [tiny](/wiki/Tiny "Tiny") and [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy") [demonic](/wiki/Demonic "Demonic") larva with no hands or limbs, and eventually grows into a full-fledged demon or other creature, depending on the being that created it. Strange larvae possess enhanced [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A strange larva has a single bite attack, and possesses [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and [resistance to death magic](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance").

Strange larvae are [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat, which primarily comes up if they are [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster.

## Generation

Strange larvae are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

Various types of monsters can generate strange larvae, which also determine what type of monsters they can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into:

- At 25 [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight"), [carcosan stings](/index.php?title=Carcosan_sting\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Carcosan sting (page does not exist)") and the insight-exclusive sting attacks of [byakhee](/index.php?title=Byakhee_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Byakhee (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") can infect armor with larvae: these larvae bite and sting the monster wearing the armor while they are inside it, and eventually emerge as strange larvae that will grow into more byakhee.
- The breath attacks of an [ancient of vitality](/wiki/Ancient_of_vitality "Ancient of vitality") infest organic items with "biting larvae", and items that are totally destroyed this way generate strange larvae that grow into [ancient nupperibos](/wiki/Ancient_nupperibo "Ancient nupperibo").
- The melee sting attacks of [akkabish tannin](/wiki/Akkabish_tannin "Akkabish tannin") each implant an egg into the target that will eventually hatch into a strange larva, which quickly grow into another akkabish tannin.
- Each turn, a [shalosh tannah](/wiki/Shalosh_tannah "Shalosh tannah") has a 1⁄9 chance of producing 1-3 strange larvae on adjacent squares - these larvae will quickly grow into either [vrocks](/wiki/Vrock "Vrock"), [hezrou](/wiki/Hezrou "Hezrou"), [nalfeshnees](/wiki/Nalfeshnee "Nalfeshnee"), or [mariliths](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith"), complete with appropriate organic equipment.

A [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of a strange larva accompanies a [hellish seal](/wiki/Hellish_seal "Hellish seal") guarded by a tannin or tannah monster - animating these statues with [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") will turn them into strange larvae that can become akkabish tannin.

## Strategy

Individually, strange larvae are not especially dangerous on their own. The true peril lies in their methods of generation, which often comes at the expense of your armor and other items and may cause combat situations to spiral out of control - this is especially in the specific case of akkabish tannin, which have six sting attacks and can easily create several more akkabish tannin if they or the larvae are not quickly dealt with.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Strange larva

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
& strange larva (No tile)
Difficulty 2
Attacks Bite 1d4 physical
& strange larva (No tile)
Difficulty 2
Attacks

Bite 1d4 physical

Base level 1
Base experience 12
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 10
Nutritional value 10
Size tiny
Resistances cold, poison, acid
Resistances conveyed none

A strange larva:

  • has no hands.
  • has no limbs.
  • has a serpent body.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is a demon.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • has infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.

A strange larva, &, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a tiny and slithy demonic larva with no hands or limbs, and eventually grows into a full-fledged demon or other creature, depending on the being that created it. Strange larvae possess enhanced regeneration and infravision.

A strange larva has a single bite attack, and possesses cold resistance, poison resistance, acid resistance, and resistance to death magic.

Strange larvae are poisonous to eat, which primarily comes up if they are digested by another monster.

Generation

Strange larvae are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

Various types of monsters can generate strange larvae, which also determine what type of monsters they can grow up into:

  • At 25 insight, carcosan stings and the insight-exclusive sting attacks of byakhee can infect armor with larvae: these larvae bite and sting the monster wearing the armor while they are inside it, and eventually emerge as strange larvae that will grow into more byakhee.
  • The breath attacks of an ancient of vitality infest organic items with "biting larvae", and items that are totally destroyed this way generate strange larvae that grow into ancient nupperibos.
  • The melee sting attacks of akkabish tannin each implant an egg into the target that will eventually hatch into a strange larva, which quickly grow into another akkabish tannin.
  • Each turn, a shalosh tannah has a 1⁄9 chance of producing 1-3 strange larvae on adjacent squares - these larvae will quickly grow into either vrocks, hezrou, nalfeshnees, or mariliths, complete with appropriate organic equipment.

A statue of a strange larva accompanies a hellish seal guarded by a tannin or tannah monster - animating these statues with stone to flesh will turn them into strange larvae that can become akkabish tannin.

Strategy

Individually, strange larvae are not especially dangerous on their own. The true peril lies in their methods of generation, which often comes at the expense of your armor and other items and may cause combat situations to spiral out of control - this is especially in the specific case of akkabish tannin, which have six sting attacks and can easily create several more akkabish tannin if they or the larvae are not quickly dealt with.

A '''strange larva''', {{gray|&}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[tiny]] and [[slithy]] [[demonic]] larva with no hands or limbs, and eventually grows into a full-fledged demon or other creature, depending on the being that created it. Strange larvae possess enhanced [[regeneration]] and [[infravision]].

A strange larva has a single bite attack, and possesses [[cold resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[acid resistance]], and [[death resistance|resistance to death magic]].

Strange larvae are [[poisonous]] to eat, which primarily comes up if they are [[digest]]ed by another monster.

==Generation==
Strange larvae are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

Various types of monsters can generate strange larvae, which also determine what type of monsters they can [[grow up]] into:

* At 25 [[insight]], [[carcosan sting]]s and the insight-exclusive sting attacks of [[Byakhee (dNetHack)|byakhee]] can infect armor with larvae: these larvae bite and sting the monster wearing the armor while they are inside it, and eventually emerge as strange larvae that will grow into more byakhee.
* The breath attacks of an [[ancient of vitality]] infest organic items with "biting larvae", and items that are totally destroyed this way generate strange larvae that grow into [[ancient nupperibo]]s.
* The melee sting attacks of [[akkabish tannin]] each implant an egg into the target that will eventually hatch into a strange larva, which quickly grow into another akkabish tannin.
* Each turn, a [[shalosh tannah]] has a {{frac|9}} chance of producing 1-3 strange larvae on adjacent squares - these larvae will quickly grow into either [[vrock]]s, [[hezrou]], [[nalfeshnee]]s, or [[marilith]]s, complete with appropriate organic equipment.

A [[statue]] of a strange larva accompanies a [[hellish seal]] guarded by a tannin or tannah monster - animating these statues with [[stone to flesh]] will turn them into strange larvae that can become akkabish tannin.

==Strategy==
Individually, strange larvae are not especially dangerous on their own. The true peril lies in their methods of generation, which often comes at the expense of your armor and other items and may cause combat situations to spiral out of control - this is especially in the specific case of akkabish tannin, which have six sting attacks and can easily create several more akkabish tannin if they or the larvae are not quickly dealt with.
